Events.text: Christopher Columbus uses his knowledge of a lunar eclipse that night to convince Native Americans to provide him with supplies.
Events.html: Christopher Columbus uses his knowledge of a lunar eclipse that night to convince Native Americans to provide him with supplies.

Events.text: Abel Tasman's second Pacific voyage began.
Events.html: Abel Tasman's second Pacific voyage began.

Events.text: Queen Anne's War: French forces and Native Americans stage a raid on Deerfield, Massachusetts Bay Colony, killing 56 villagers and taking more than 100 captive.
Events.html: Queen Anne's War: French forces and Native Americans stage a raid on Deerfield, Massachusetts Bay Colony, killing 56 villagers and taking more than 100 captive.

Events.text: February 29 is followed by February 30 in Sweden, in a move to abolish the Swedish calendar for a return to the Old style.
Events.html: February 29 is followed by February 30 in Sweden, in a move to abolish the Swedish calendar for a return to the Old style.

Events.text: Ulrika Eleonora, Queen of Sweden abdicates in favour of her husband, who becomes King Frederick I on 24 March.
Events.html: Ulrika Eleonora, Queen of Sweden abdicates in favour of her husband, who becomes King Frederick I on 24 March.

Events.text: King Alaungpaya founds Konbaung Dynasty, the last dynasty of Burmese monarchy.
Events.html: King Alaungpaya founds Konbaung Dynasty, the last dynasty of Burmese monarchy.

Events.text: Polish nobles formed Bar Confederation.
Events.html: Polish nobles formed Bar Confederation.

Events.text: The Jay Treaty between the United States and Great Britain comes into force, facilitating ten years of peaceful trade between the two nations.
Events.html: The Jay Treaty between the United States and Great Britain comes into force, facilitating ten years of peaceful trade between the two nations.

Events.text: American Civil War: Kilpatrick–Dahlgren Raid fails: Plans to free 15,000 Union soldiers being held near Richmond, Virginia are thwarted.
Events.html: American Civil War: Kilpatrick–Dahlgren Raid fails: Plans to free 15,000 Union soldiers being held near Richmond, Virginia are thwarted.

Events.text: St. Petersburg, Florida is incorporated.
Events.html: St. Petersburg, Florida is incorporated.

Events.text: The Piedra Movediza (Moving Stone) of Tandil falls and breaks.
Events.html: The Piedra Movediza (Moving Stone) of Tandil falls and breaks.

Events.text: Tokelau is annexed by the United Kingdom.
Events.html: Tokelau is annexed by the United Kingdom.

Events.text: Child labor: In South Carolina, the minimum working age for factory, mill, and mine workers is raised from twelve to fourteen years old.
Events.html: 1916 – Child labor: In South Carolina, the minimum working age for factory, mill, and mine workers is raised from twelve to fourteen years old.

Events.text: Czechoslovak National assembly adopted the Constitution.
Events.html: Czechoslovak National assembly adopted the Constitution.

Events.text: February 26 Incident in Tokyo ends.
Events.html: February 26 Incident in Tokyo ends.

Events.text: For her performance as "Mammy" in Gone with the Wind, Hattie McDaniel becomes the first African American to win an Academy Award.
Events.html: For her performance as "Mammy" in Gone with the Wind, Hattie McDaniel becomes the first African American to win an Academy Award.

Events.text: Finland initiates Winter War peace negotiations.
Events.html: 1940 – Finland initiates Winter War peace negotiations.

Events.text: In a ceremony held in Berkeley, California, because of the war, physicist Ernest Lawrence receives the 1939 Nobel Prize in Physics from Sweden's Consul General in San Francisco.
Events.html: 1940 – In a ceremony held in Berkeley, California, because of the war, physicist Ernest Lawrence receives the 1939 Nobel Prize in Physics from Sweden's Consul General in San Francisco.

Events.text: World War II: The Admiralty Islands are invaded in Operation Brewer led by American General Douglas MacArthur.
Events.html: World War II: The Admiralty Islands are invaded in Operation Brewer led by American General Douglas MacArthur.

Events.text: The island of Heligoland is restored to German authority.
Events.html: The island of Heligoland is restored to German authority.

Events.text: The 5.7 Mw Agadir earthquake shakes coastal Morocco with a maximum perceived intensity of X (Extreme), destroying Agadir, and leaving 12,000 dead and another 12,000 injured.
Events.html: The 5.7 Mw Agadir earthquake shakes coastal Morocco with a maximum perceived intensity of X (Extreme), destroying Agadir, and leaving 12,000 dead and another 12,000 injured.

Events.text: In Sydney, Australian swimmer Dawn Fraser sets a new world record in the 100-meter freestyle swimming competition (58.9 seconds).
Events.html: In Sydney, Australian swimmer Dawn Fraser sets a new world record in the 100-meter freestyle swimming competition (58.9 seconds).

Events.text: Vietnam War: Vietnamization: South Korea withdraws 11,000 of its 48,000 troops from Vietnam.
Events.html: Vietnam War: Vietnamization: South Korea withdraws 11,000 of its 48,000 troops from Vietnam.

Events.text: Gordie Howe of the then Hartford Whalers makes NHL history as he scores his 800th goal.
Events.html: Gordie Howe of the then Hartford Whalers makes NHL history as he scores his 800th goal.

Events.text: South African archbishop Desmond Tutu is arrested along with 100 clergymen during a five-day anti-apartheid demonstration in Cape Town.
Events.html: South African archbishop Desmond Tutu is arrested along with 100 clergymen during a five-day anti-apartheid demonstration in Cape Town.

Events.text: Svend Robinson becomes the first member of the Canadian House of Commons to come out as gay.
Events.html: 1988 – Svend Robinson becomes the first member of the Canadian House of Commons to come out as gay.

Events.text: First day of Bosnia and Herzegovina independence referendum.
Events.html: First day of Bosnia and Herzegovina independence referendum.

Events.text: Faucett Flight 251 crashes in the Andes, all 123 passengers and crew died.
Events.html: Faucett Flight 251 crashes in the Andes, all 123 passengers and crew died.

Events.text: Siege of Sarajevo officially ends.
Events.html: 1996 – Siege of Sarajevo officially ends.

Events.text: Second Chechen War: Eighty-four Russian paratroopers are killed in a rebel attack on a guard post near Ulus Kert.
Events.html: Second Chechen War: Eighty-four Russian paratroopers are killed in a rebel attack on a guard post near Ulus Kert.

Events.text: Jean-Bertrand Aristide is removed as President of Haiti following a coup.
Events.html: Jean-Bertrand Aristide is removed as President of Haiti following a coup.

Events.text: The United Kingdom's Ministry of Defence decides to withdraw Prince Harry from a tour of Afghanistan "immediately" after a leak led to his deployment being reported by foreign media.
Events.html: The United Kingdom's Ministry of Defence decides to withdraw Prince Harry from a tour of Afghanistan "immediately" after a leak led to his deployment being reported by foreign media.

Events.text: Misha Defonseca admits to fabricating her memoir, Misha: A Mémoire of the Holocaust Years, in which she claimed to have lived with a pack of wolves in the woods during the Holocaust.
Events.html: 2008 – Misha Defonseca admits to fabricating her memoir, Misha: A Mémoire of the Holocaust Years, in which she claimed to have lived with a pack of wolves in the woods during the Holocaust.

links.title: Misha: A Mémoire of the Holocaust Years

Events.text: Tokyo Skytree construction completed. It is, as of 2016, the tallest tower in the world, 634 meters high, and second tallest (man-made) structure on Earth, next to Burj Khalifa.
Events.html: Tokyo Skytree construction completed. It is, as of 2016, the tallest tower in the world, 634 meters high, and second tallest (man-made) structure on Earth, next to Burj Khalifa.

links.title: List of tallest towers in the world
